text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Furukawa was born in Osaka Prefecture on July 5, 1934. After graduating from Kansai University, he joined Dunlop Japan in 1957. In June 1956, when Furukawa was a Kansai University student, he was selected for the Japan national team for the 1956 Summer Olympics qualification. At this qualification, on June 3, he debuted against South Korea. In November, he played in the 1956 Summer Olympics in Melbourne. He also played in the 1958 Asian Games. He played 19 games for Japan until 1962. ==Statistics== Japan National Football Team Database |- |1956||3||0 |- |1957||0||0 |- |1958||3||0 |- |1959||10||0 |- |1960||0||0 |- |1961||1||0 |- |1962||2||0 |- !Total||19||0 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1934 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Osaka Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers Category:Footballers at the 1956 Summer Olympics
title: Yoshio Furukawa
